intro: Pelazoneuron puberulum var. sonorense, commonly known as the Sonoran Desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are covered in a fine layer of hair, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well-suited to desert environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
